contents.title: Nuxt
contents.description: vue-recaptcha supports Nuxt.js out of the box.

children.value: or empty string to reset reCAPTCHA checkbox.

props.code:
<script setup lang="ts">
  import { RecaptchaV2State } from '#recaptcha'

  const map = {
    [RecaptchaV2State.Init]: 'Click to Challenge',
    [RecaptchaV2State.Verified]: 'Verified',
    [RecaptchaV2State.Expired]: 'Expired',
    [RecaptchaV2State.Error]: 'Error',
  }

  const response = ref()
  </script>

  <template>
    <ChallengeV2 v-slot="{ state }" v-model="response">
      <PrimaryButton>{{ map[state] }}{{ response ? ` ${response.slice(0, 6)}...` : '' }}</PrimaryButton>
    </ChallengeV2>
  </template>

This is the position that usually place a your submit button. When click on the content,
will automatically execute the reCAPTCHA challenge by default

props.code:
interface SlotApi {
  /**
   * widget id
   */
  widgetId: WidgetID | undefined
  /**
   * reCAPTCHA state
   */
  state: RecaptchaV2State

  isError: boolean
  isExpired: boolean
  isVerified: boolean

  /**
   * reset reCAPTCHA
   */
  reset: () => void
  /**
   * execute challenge
   */
  execute: () => void
}

children.value:
flowchart TD
Init -->|Challenge| Verified
Init -->|Challenge| Error
Verified -->|Challenge expired| Expired
Error -->|Reset| Init
Verified -->|Reset| Init
Expired -->|Reset| Init

contents.title: useRecaptchaProvider
contents.description: The function that setup the required scripts for reCAPTCHA. It must be called in your app, or vue-recaptcha won't work.

children.value: The function that setup the required scripts for reCAPTCHA. It must be called in your app, or vue-recaptcha won't work.

props.code:
<script setup lang="ts">
import { useRecaptchaProvider } from 'vue-recaptcha'

useRecaptchaProvider()
</script>

children.value: A composable to help you mount the reCAPTCHA checkbox or invisible reCAPTCHA
* Option that pass to reCAPTCHA render

props.code:
export interface UseChallengeV2Return {
  /**
   * root element ref to mount reCAPTCHA
   */
  root: Ref<Element | undefined>
  /**
   * reCAPTCHA widget id
   */
  widgetID: Ref<WidgetID | undefined>

  /**
   * state of reCAPTCHA
   */
  state: Ref<RecaptchaV2State>

  /**
   * the verified event
   */
  onVerify: EventHookOn<string>
  /**
   * the expired event
   */
  onExpired: EventHookOn<void>
  /**
   * the error event
   */
  onError: EventHookOn<Error>

  /**
   * execute the challenge
   */
  execute: () => void
  /**
   * reset reCAPTCHA
   */
  reset: () => void
}

children.value: * root element ref to mount reCAPTCHA
for more information about the options.

props.code:
<script>
import { useChallengeV2 } from 'vue-recaptcha'

const { root, onVerify } = useChallengeV2({
  options: {
    theme: 'light',
    size: 'normal',
  }
})

onVerify((response) => {
  // do something with response
  console.log(response)
})
</script>

<template>
  <div ref="root" />
</template>

children.value: // It's important to pass `size: 'invisible'` to render a invisible reCAPTCHA
<!-- You must give an empty div to render the invisible reCAPTCHA -->
A composable to help you execute the reCAPTCHA v3 challenge

contents.title: Customize reCAPTCHA script loading
contents.description: By default vue-recaptcha will use unhead to load the reCAPTCHA script.

children.value: If you need to completely control how to load the reCAPTCHA script. You can use
to create a plugin with your own
// This function will be called by useRecaptchaProvider
// You can use any way to load the reCAPTCHA script
// You must pass these two value as query string to reCAPTCHA
// Below you can customize as you want
* you can use recaptcha.net instead of google.com, if you set recaptchaApiURL, this option will be ignored
* you can use your own recaptcha api url, if you set this option, useRecaptchaNet will be ignored
*  Helper function for define your own loadScript function
